label: draft sequence repository contextual data standard
definition: This draft specification provides a collection of fields related to the contextual data of a specimen, its genomic sequencing, and its pathogenic epidemiology.
ui_label: draft sequence repository contextual data standard

label: contact specification - specimen related organization
definition: Contact information for an organization related to specimen collection, processing or storage.

label: organization name
definition: A textual identifier for an organization. [def-source: NCI]

label: First Name
definition: A word or group of words indicating a person's first (personal or given) name; the name that precedes the surname.

label: Last Name
definition: A word or group of words indicating a person's last (family) name.

label: Job Title
definition: A local name for an individual's occupation.
help: Where personnel turnover may affect the ability for follow up, the contact information can be supplied for a job position rather than a specific individual.

label: E-mail Address
definition: A text string identifier for a location to which e-mail can be delivered.

label: Telephone Number
definition: A sequence of decimal digits (0-9) that is used for identifying a destination telephone line or other device in a telephone network.

label: Country
definition: A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states.

label: first-order administrative region
definition: A primary administrative division of a country, such as a state in the United States.

label: Municipality
definition: A political unit, such as a city, town, or village, incorporated for local self-government.

label: Street Address
definition: The street name and building number where a person or organization can be found.
help: The Street Address should include the building number and street name.

label: draft sequence repository data - specimen collection
draft sequence repository data - geographic location
definition: The geographical origin of the sample by city, region, country or latitude and logitude.

label: INSDC country qualifier
definition: The INSDC country qualifier is a textual controlled vocabulary used to indicate the country of origin of a DNA sample.  It can also have the following format: country:sub_region, such as: "Canada:Vancouver".

label: latitude and longitude coordinate (ISO 6709)
help: Use ISO 6709 standard. Values should be stored in signed decimal degrees format based on the WGS84 geodetic reference system. Multiple value pairs may be entered if the site is not a point. Latitude and longitude should not be abstracted to the centre of a city, province/state or country as this may falsely implicate an existing location.

label: latitude (ISO 6709)
definition: A decimal latitude measurement in degrees in conformance with the ISO 6709 standard.

label: longitude (ISO 6709)
definition: A decimal longitude measurement in degrees in conformance with the ISO 6709 standard.

label: specimen extraction location - state/province/territory/region
definition: A specimen extraction location - city or region is the Gazetteer ontology identifier or textual name of the most precise geographical location available for the site of a specimen extraction event.

label: specimen extraction location - city
definition: The specimen extraction location - city is the city where a specimen was taken (extracted) from a subject or environment

label: specimen extraction location - geographic feature
definition: A geographic location where a given specimen was extracted or collected from. Location can be identified at country, city, postal address, or longitude and latitude level of granularity. It can also be described by biome, physiographic and other environmental features.

label: anthropogenic geographic feature
definition: An anthropogenic geographic feature is a geographic feature resulting from the influence of human beings on nature.

label: biome
definition: A biome is an environmental system to which resident ecological communities have evolved adaptations.

label: specimen type (host or environmental context)
definition: The type of material from which the specimen was obtained. Specimens are usually categorized as food, body products or tissues, or environmental material.

label: specimen collection time measurement datum
definition: A time measurement datum that is the measure of the time when the specimens are collected.
help: The sample collection date should be recorded as YYYY-MM-DD according to ISO 8601.

label: specimen collection process
definition: A planned process with the objective of collecting a specimen.
help: Collection Methods are not always known, however when specified, they should be selected from an ontology controlled vocabulary.

label: specimen extraction device
definition: The tool or device used to extract a specimen.
help: Collection Devices are not always known, however when specified, they should be selected from an ontology controlled vocabulary.

label: environmental material
definition: A portion of environmental material is a fiat object which forms the medium or part of the medium of an environmental system.
help: Food is considered to be a separate field from Environmental Material.

label: environmental feature
definition: A material entity which determines an environmental system.
help: Food-related environmental locations may include, but are not exclusive to, food production, processing, distribution and retail environments that were sampled. Where Environmental Locations apply, descriptors should be selected from an ontology controlled vocabulary. Format: Ontology\nSource: GenEpiO slim, FoodOn slim, or EnvO

label: subject organism (host) taxonomic species
definition: The species of the host organism from which a specimen (pathogen) organism was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

label: subject health status (GSCID-BRC)
definition: A description of whether a given subject organism appeared healthy, sick or deceased at the time of specimen extraction. If sick or deceased, additional details should be provided in project-specific fields.

label: subject disease
definition: Name of disease in a subject that is related to a given investigation, study and/or specimen.

label: subject body product
definition: substance produced by the body, e.g. stool, mucus, where the specimen was obtained from.
help: Body Products may refer to animal or plant samples as well as clinical samples. Body Products are considered to be anatomical substances that can move through a body. Tissue types should be specified in the Anatomical Site field.

label: subject anatomical site
definition: Name of body site where the specimen was obtained from, such as a specific organ or tissue.
help: Anatomical sites can pertain to both clinical, animal and plant samples. Materials that move through a body (e.g. feces, urine, blood) should be specified in the Body Products field.

label: serovar
definition: A serotype or serovar is a distinct variation within a species of bacteria or virus or among immune cells of different individuals. These microorganisms, viruses, or cells are classified together based on their cell surface antigens, allowing the epidemiologic classification of organisms to the sub-species level

label: specimen organism taxonomy (species)
definition: This is the taxonomic species descriptor of a specimen isolate (an organism found within a specimen.)

label: strain identifier
definition: A strain identifier is the unique microbial or eukaryotic strain name from a reference database that a sample has been matched to.

label: isolate identifier
definition: An isolate identifier is an identifier assigned to a given isolate by a particular agency that is handling or storing it.

label: culture medium
definition: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.

label: isolation medium
definition: An isolation medium is a culture medium which has the disposition to encourage growth of particular bacteria to the exclusion of others in the same growth environment.

label: draft sequence repository data - isolate passage history
number of passages
definition: The number of serial iterations that an isolate is grown in one environment.

label: passage protocol
definition: The number of serial iterations that an isolate is grown in one environment.
help: The Passage Protocol should include, when applicable, inoculum size, media type, temperature and duration of incubation.

label: draft sequence repository data - food specimen
definition: This specification offers food source, product type, packaging and processing attributes relevant to describing a food specimen.

label: food specimen type
definition: A food specimen type is a categorization of a food specimen, by the organism it is or came from, or by a class of food products.

label: food source
definition: Individual plant or animal from which the food product or its major ingredient is derived; also a chemical food source [FDA CFSAN 1995].

label: Proprietary Name
definition: The part of the name or logo associated with a specific product or service identifying and distinguishing it from varieties of the same product or service marketed by competing companies.

label: extent of food heat treatment
definition: Used to broadly characterize a food product based on the extent of heat applied. Heat treatment affects the flavor and textural characteristics of a food and thus consumer preparation time. Heat treatment causes chemical changes and/or reduction of enzyme and of microbial activity and thus affects food safety and shelflife. Specifics of preparation are covered by *G. COOKING METHOD* and *H. TREATMENT APPLIED*. [FDA CFSAN 1995]

label: food physical quality
definition: The physical state of the food product (liquid, semiliquid, semisolid, or solid). Solid food products are further subdivided by shape or form. Terms are provided for products that have both liquid and solid components or that incorporate air or other gases. [FDA CFSAN 1995]

label: food preservation process
definition: The methods contributing to the prevention or retardation of microbial, enzymatic or oxidative spoilage and thus to the extension of shelf life. Index all methods for which information is available, even if a corresponding descriptor has already been used in *H. TREATMENT APPLIED*. Preservation descriptors refer to the finished food as a whole with these exceptions: (1) if the components of a multi-component food, such as cream pie, are preservation by different methods, index all methods; (2)  if chemical preservatives are declared on the label, always index them even if it is known that the preservative was introduced through or is only present in a component or ingredient of the food; and (3) if the preservation method for an ingredient is declared on the label (such as brie cheese made from pasteurized milk) index it. Also use *INGREDIENT preservation by THERMAL PROCESSING* or *INGREDIENT preservation by IRRADIATION* when ingredients have been pasteurized, ultrapasteurized, sterilized or irradiated.

label: food container or wrapping
definition: Type of container or wrapping defined by the main container material, the container form, and the material of the liner lids or ends. Also type of container or wrapping by form; prefer description by material first, then by form.  [FDA CFSAN 1995]

label: food packing medium
definition: The medium in which the food is packed for preservation and handling or the medium surrounding homemade foods, e.g., peaches cooked in sugar syrup. The packing medium may provide a controlled environment for the food. It may also serve to improve palatability and consumer appeal.

label: food contact surface
definition: The specific container or coating materials in direct contact with the food. Multiple values can be assigned. [FDA CFSAN 1995]

label: draft sequence repository data - antibiogram
definition: A dataset of the minimal inhibitory concentrations (value, unit, sign (<,>, =)) and resistance phenotypes (resistant, sensitive or undetermined) of the sequenced isolate against different antibiotics tested.

label: Microbial Susceptibility Test
definition: A method to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.

label: antimicrobial resistance tissue specificity
definition: The tissue type used to select breakpoints from a particular standard, for the interpretation of MIC results.
help: Tissue Specificity (AST Breakpoint) only needs to be specified when the standard used to interpret the MIC requires this information e.g. selecting CLSI veterinary breakpoints.

label: draft antibiogram drug test model
definition: This is the minimal set of parameters for drug test results for a particular antimicrobial agent.

label: antimicrobial resistance test drug
definition: This is a collection of drugs used to test antimicrobial resistance.
help: Standard chemical or generic drug names, rather than common or brand names, should be selected from an ontology controlled vocabulary.

label: draft sequence repository data - antibiogram MIC measurement
definition: This is a component of an antibiogram that enables a choice of MIC measurements based on either the diffusion or dilution method. These methods call for different numeric input ranges and units.

label: MIC dilution measurement
definition: A MIC test measurement resulting from a laboratory diffusion method.

label: MIC diffusion measurement
definition: A MIC test measurement resulting from a laboratory diffusion method.

label: drug minimum inhibitory concentration unit
definition: The unit provided for an antibiotic drug test dosage.

label: Microbial Susceptibility Test Result
definition: The outcome of a test to determine whether microbial growth is affected by an antimicrobial compound.
help: The Resistance Phenotype depends on the breakpoint thresholds applied, which in turn depend on the reference standard used for interpretation. Breakpoints can also be host, organism, drug, and infection site-specific. In cases where a standard requires Host, Organism, Drug Name, and Tissue Specificity (AST Breakpoint) information for the appropriate selection of breakpoints, these should be specified.

label: test drug minimum concentration
definition: This is the minimum concentration of a drug applied during an an assay.
help: The Minimum Drug Concentration Tested should be given as a numerical value. The units will be assumed to be the same as the MIC.

label: test drug maximum concentration
definition: This is the maximum concentration of a drug applied during an an assay.
help: The Maximum Drug Concentration Tested should be given as a numerical value. The units will be assumed to be the same as the MIC.

label: antimicrobial resistance testing method version or reagent
definition: The commercial kit or product used to determine the MIC e.g. E-Test. If a commercial product was not used, include the type of media used.

label: antimicrobial resistance testing reference standard
definition: The clinical and laboratory guidelines or standards that prescribe the threshold values for determining resistance phenotypes.

label: antimicrobial resistance testing platform
definition: The instrumentation used to determine minimum inhibitory concentration values.

label: raw sequence data processing datum
definition: The procedures used to remove adapters from raw sequence reads, trim low quality bases and where applicable, merge paired-end reads.
help: Include name and version of trimming tool and if applicable, paired-end merger program. It is recommended that parameters are also recorded.

label: read adapter trimming
definition: the removal of adapter sequences from demultiplexed data reads

label: read adapter trimming software
definition: The name and version of the software product used for removal of adapter sequences from demultiplexed data reads

label: read paired-end merging software
definition: The name and version of the software used to merge paired-end reads before assembly.

label: read trimming and filtering software
definition: The name and version of software used in a bioinformatics workflow to improve the quality of sequencing reads.
help: Include the name and version of filtering tool(s) and processes applied.

label: sequencing run date
definition: date the sequencing run was performed
help: The sequencing date should be recorded as YYYY-MM-DD according to ISO 8601.

label: culture medium
definition: a processed material that provides the needed nourishment for microorganisms or cells grown in vitro.

label: sequencing dna extraction method
definition: The procedure used to obtain genomic DNA from a sample through chemical, physical or mechanical means.
help: Include the name of the commercial kit and version number, or laboratory protocol, used to extract the genomic DNA of the isolated organism.

label: replicate
definition: A role played by a a biological sample in the context of an experiment where the intent is that biological or technical variation is measured.
help: Replicates within a set of sequencing runs should be described as either technical or biological.

label: library preparation kit
definition: Packaged kits (containing adapters, indexes, enzymes, buffers etc), tailored for specific sequencing workflows, which allow the simplified preparation of sequencing-ready libraries for small genomes, amplicons, and plasmids.
help: Include the name of the commercial kit and version number, or laboratory protocol, used to prepare libraries for sequencing.

label: library preparation kit version
definition: The version identifier of a packaged kit tailored for specific sequencing workflows.

label: sequencing chemistry
definition: lab method to determine the order of nucleotides in a DNA molecule

label: sequencing instrument model
definition: A product name and model number of a manufacturer's genomic (dna) sequencer.

label: assembly method
definition: Assembly method refers to how the reads were assembled into contigs for which either a de novo or mapping (reference based) strategy is used.
help: Describe the bioinformatics pipeline used, including the name and version of assembler software, and accession number of the reference genome used in the case of reference-based assembly. It is recommended that parameters are also recorded.

label: genome annotation algorithm
definition: Program used for annotation
help: Include the name and version of annotation tool. It is recommended that parameters are also recorded.

label: draft sequence repository data - sequencing quality control
definition: Measurements or calculated quantities used to assess the extent and success of the sequence assembly process. Metric thresholds are species-specific.

label: read coverage
definition: Coverage (read depth or depth) is the average number of reads representing a given nucleotide in the reconstructed sequence.
help: Sequencing depth should be reported as a numerical value as X times fold e.g. 30x

label: assembly genome size
definition: The assembly genome size is the sum of all lengths of a sequence assembly's contigs.
help: The size of the assembled genome should be reported as a numerical value in Mb e.g. 5.2 Mb.

label: breadth of coverage
definition: The breadth of coverage is the percentage of the genome that was sequenced to a prescribed depth of coverage.
help: Breadth of coverage should be reported as a percentage value (e.g. 95%) to a fold of coverage (e.g. 10X).

label: contig N50
definition: N50 statistic computed for the contigs produced by the assembly process. A contig N50 is calculated by first ordering every contig by length from longest to shortest. Next, starting from the longest contig, the lengths of each contig are summed, until this running sum equals one-half of the total length of all contigs in the assembly. The contig N50 of the assembly is the length of the shortest contig in this list.
help: N50 should be reported as a numerical value in Mb e.g. 0.75 Mb

label: contig count
definition: A contig count is the count of contigs that belong to a sequence assembly.
help: Number of contigs should be reported as a numerical value e.g. 5.

label: mean contig length
definition: The mean contig length is the count of base pairs in the average size contig of the sequence assembly.

label: draft sequence repository data - virulence
definition: The virulence factors determined to be present in the sequenced isolate by phenotypic or target amplification methods e.g. Shiga toxins, hemolysins.

label: virulence factor name
definition: The name of the virulence factor molecule produced by a pathogen that specifically causes disease, or that influences the host's function to allow the pathogen to thrive.

label: virulence testing protocol name
definition: The laboratory protocol used to determine virulence phenotypes and markers.
help: The protocol for determining virulence should include, when applicable, inoculum preparation, platforms and instrumentation, conditions, cell lines and animal models.

label: detection limit
definition: The detection limit denotes the smallest measure that can be detected with reasonable certainty for a given analytical procedure.
help: Detection limits should include the numerical cut-off (threshold) value and units for determining positive results e.g. qPCR value, CFUs.

label: draft sequence repository data - submission to EBI
specimen strain or isolate identifier
definition: Name of strain from which sample was obtained OR name of isolate from which sample was obtained.
help: This information can be derived exactly from the ISO Strain or Isolate field. Only one value should be provided, at the discretion of the submitter.

label: specimen organism taxonomy (species)
definition: This is the taxonomic species descriptor of a specimen isolate (an organism found within a specimen.)

label: serovar
definition: A serotype or serovar is a distinct variation within a species of bacteria or virus or among immune cells of different individuals. These microorganisms, viruses, or cells are classified together based on their cell surface antigens, allowing the epidemiologic classification of organisms to the sub-species level

label: EBI ENA Webin environmental feature
definition: identifies sequences derived by direct molecular isolation from a bulk environmental DNA sample (by PCR with or without subsequent cloning of the product, DGGE, or other anonymous methods) with no reliable identification of the source organism. Environmental samples include clinical samples, gut contents, and other sequences from anonymous organisms that may be associated with a particular host. They do not include endosymbionts that can be reliably recovered from a particular host, organisms from a readily identifiable but uncultured field sample (e.g., many cyanobacteria), or phytoplasmas that can be reliably recovered from diseased plants (even though these cannot be grown in axenic culture).
help: used only with the source feature key; source feature keys containing the /environmental_sample qualifier should also contain the /isolation_source qualifier. entries including /environmental_sample must not include the /strain qualifier

label: specimen collection time measurement datum
definition: A time measurement datum that is the measure of the time when the specimens are collected.
help: This information can be derived from the ISO Collection Date field. If the stakeholder must include a truncated version due to data sharing constraints, only include the year (YYYY format).

label: specimen extraction by
definition: The "specimen extraction by" is a datum containing the name of persons or institute who collected a given specimen.

label: Person Name
definition: A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.

label: organization name
definition: A textual identifier for an organization. [def-source: NCI]

label: draft sequence repository data - geographic location
definition: The geographical origin of the sample by city, region, country or latitude and logitude.
help:
Only lat_lon or country information should be provided, at the discretion of the submitter.*
Lat_lon information can be derived by concatenating a subset of the ISO Geographic Location of Sample Collection fields prescribed by Annex
B. Specifically, Latitude and Longitude information should be concatenated and separated by a space.
Country information can be derived exactly from the ISO Country field in Annex B.

label: INSDC country qualifier
definition: The INSDC country qualifier is a textual controlled vocabulary used to indicate the country of origin of a DNA sample.  It can also have the following format: country:sub_region, such as: "Canada:Vancouver".

label: latitude and longitude coordinate (ISO 6709)
help: Use ISO 6709 standard. Values should be stored in signed decimal degrees format based on the WGS84 geodetic reference system. Multiple value pairs may be entered if the site is not a point. Latitude and longitude should not be abstracted to the centre of a city, province/state or country as this may falsely implicate an existing location.

label: latitude (ISO 6709)
definition: A decimal latitude measurement in degrees in conformance with the ISO 6709 standard.

label: longitude (ISO 6709)
definition: A decimal longitude measurement in degrees in conformance with the ISO 6709 standard.

label: specimen extraction location - state/province/territory/region
definition: A specimen extraction location - city or region is the Gazetteer ontology identifier or textual name of the most precise geographical location available for the site of a specimen extraction event.

label: specimen extraction location - city
definition: The specimen extraction location - city is the city where a specimen was taken (extracted) from a subject or environment

label: specimen extraction location - geographic feature
definition: A geographic location where a given specimen was extracted or collected from. Location can be identified at country, city, postal address, or longitude and latitude level of granularity. It can also be described by biome, physiographic and other environmental features.
help: This information can be derived by concatenating the information for Sample Type and related fields, separated by a colon.

label: anthropogenic geographic feature
definition: An anthropogenic geographic feature is a geographic feature resulting from the influence of human beings on nature.

label: biome
definition: A biome is an environmental system to which resident ecological communities have evolved adaptations.

label: subject organism (host) taxonomic species
definition: The species of the host organism from which a specimen (pathogen) organism was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

label: subject health status (GSCID-BRC)
definition: A description of whether a given subject organism appeared healthy, sick or deceased at the time of specimen extraction. If sick or deceased, additional details should be provided in project-specific fields.
help: This field is specific to the EBI. If the host was associated with a disease in the ISO Host Disease field, choose “diseased”, if the host did not manifest disease, choose “healthy”.

label: draft sequence repository data - submission to NCBI/DDBJ
latitude and longitude coordinate (NCBI BioSample format)
definition: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W
help: This information can be derived by concatenating a subset of the ISO Geographic Location of Sample Collection fields prescribed by Annex\nB. Specifically, Latitude and Longitude information should be concatenated and separated by a space.

label: specimen identifier
definition: A CRID symbol denotes a specimen and used to distinguish one specimen from another in an investigation.

label: isolate identifier
definition: An isolate identifier is an identifier assigned to a given isolate by a particular agency that is handling or storing it.

label: strain identifier
definition: A strain identifier is the unique microbial or eukaryotic strain name from a reference database that a sample has been matched to.

label: specimen organism taxonomy (species)
definition: This is the taxonomic species descriptor of a specimen isolate (an organism found within a specimen.)

label: specimen category
definition: Specimen category is a categorical variable that broadly indicates the source of a specimen in order for data processing systems like NCBI's biosample submission portal to anticipate other fields related to the source. Currently this distinguishes between "clinical or host associated" specimens and "environmental/food or other pathogen" specimens.

label: specimen collection time measurement datum
definition: A time measurement datum that is the measure of the time when the specimens are collected.
help: This information can be derived from the ISO Collection Date field. If the stakeholder must include a truncated version due to data sharing constraints, only include the year (YYYY format).

label: specimen extraction by
definition: The "specimen extraction by" is a datum containing the name of persons or institute who collected a given specimen.

label: Person Name
definition: A word or group of words indicating the identity of a person usually consisting of a first (personal) name and a last (family) name with an optional middle name. In some cultural traditions the family name comes first.

label: organization name
definition: A textual identifier for an organization. [def-source: NCI]

label: draft NCBI BioSample geo_loc_name model
definition: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"
help: This information can be derived by concatenating a subset of the ISO Geographic Location of Sample Collection fields prescribed by Annex B. Specifically, City, Province/State/Territory, Country information should be concatenated and separated by colons.*

label: Municipality
definition: A political unit, such as a city, town, or village, incorporated for local self-government.

label: Country
definition: A collective generic term that refers here to a wide variety of dependencies, areas of special sovereignty, uninhabited islands, and other entities in addition to the traditional countries or independent states.

label: first-order administrative region
definition: A primary administrative division of a country, such as a state in the United States.

label: specimen source context
definition: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.
help: This information can be derived by concatenating the information for Sample Type and related fields, separated by a colon.

label: subject organism (host) taxonomic species
definition: The species of the host organism from which a specimen (pathogen) organism was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

label: subject organism common name
definition: The natural language (non-taxonomic) name of the type of organism (human or animal) that is the subject of a given investigation, study and/or specimen.

label: subject disease
definition: Name of disease in a subject that is related to a given investigation, study and/or specimen.
help: e.g. gastroenteritis.
